p: Negative and positive control tests were performed in parallel for comparison. The first negative control contained ordinary laboratory larval rearing water; the second negative control contained an aqueous solution of 0.88% of dimethylsulfoxide (DMSO), used as a dispersing medium for the essential oils. The positive control contained an aqueous solution 0.05Â mg/L of the organothiophosphate insecticide Fenthion (according to the diagnostic dosages for control of Ae. aegypti, indicated by the World Health Organization [ 47].
